channel.title: Hosted Private Cloud Status - Incident History

item.title: [Global][PCC] - Maintenance upgrade host - wave 4
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 7, 07:00 UTC  -  Mar 11, 17:00 UTC

Feb 25, 22:21 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 07/03/2022 07:00 UTC
End time : 11/03/2022 17:00 UTC
Description : If you are from wave 4 you will receive a mail from us and you will be able to schedule again with the manager.
Builds will be pushed to the host, put in maintenance mode, all Virtual machines will be moved with Vmotion and last hosts will be rebooted .
If we meet an issue during the reboot of the host , it will be replaced. (20 min)

If major update have to be done, it will be two successive reboots like this:

Host v6.0 : upgrade major to v6.7, reboot, then upgrade minor to the last build v6.7, reboot.
Host v6.5 : upgrade major to v6.7, reboot, then upgrade minor to the last build v6.7, reboot.
Host v6.7 : upgrade minor to the last build 19195723 if needed, reboot.

If hosts are already on build 19195723, they will be skipped.
Service impact : None
Service improvement : All hosts have to be upgraded frequently due to the VMware's matrix of compatibility and also due to the CVE.

item.title: [EU/CA/SNC][PCC] Upgrade Vrops v8.6.2
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 7, 07:00 UTC  -  Mar 17, 17:00 UTC

Feb 17, 05:09 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 07/03/2022 07:00UTC
End time : 17/03/2022 17:00UTC
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : All Vrops zones
Service impact : No access to vrops will be be possible during the maintenance
Service improvement : Multiple vulnerabilities in VMware vRealize Operations were privately reported to VMware. Patches and Workarounds are available to address these vulnerabilities in impacted VMware products.

item.title: [Global][PCC] - Maintenance upgrade host - wave 3
item.description:
Feb 28, 08:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 22, 21:12 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 28/02/2022 08:00 UTC
End time : 04/03/2022 18:00 UTC
Description :
If you are from wave 3 you will receive a mail from us and you will be able to schedule again with the manager.
Builds will be pushed to the host, put in maintenance mode, all Virtual machines will be moved with Vmotion and last hosts will be rebooted .
If we meet an issue during the reboot of the host , it will be replaced. (20 min)

If major update have to be done, it will be two successive reboots like this:

Host v6.0 : upgrade major to v6.7, reboot, then upgrade minor to the last build v6.7, reboot.
Host v6.5 : upgrade major to v6.7, reboot, then upgrade minor to the last build v6.7, reboot.
Host v6.7 : upgrade minor to the last build 19195723 if needed, reboot.

If hosts are already on build 19195723, they will be skipped.
Service impact :None
Service improvement : All hosts have to be upgraded frequently due to the VMware's matrix of compatibility and also due to the CVE.

item.title: [RBX2][Storage] - tete-496
item.description:
Jan 30, 03:24 UTC
Resolved - Resolved: The migration of virtual machines went well. The virtual machines administration services are up now since 02:30 UTC.

Jan 30, 00:06 UTC
Update - Ongoing Actions: The slave spare went well, we are testing the performance, we will come back to you to give you a new update as soon as possible. Thank you for your understanding.

Jan 29, 22:23 UTC
Update - Ongoing Actions: Our technical teams will carry out an intervention to spare the slave head. During the intervention the virtual machines will be unavailable. The intervention will last about 1 hour.

Jan 29, 19:58 UTC
Identified - Start time: 29/01/2022 18:06 UTC
User impact : Administration VMs ( vcenter, vcsa, pcc master rbx2a, nsx, gw) are unreachable
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2a
Scope of impact : The impacted pool is pcc-003516.
Root cause : Hardware issue.
Ongoin Actions: Our teams are currently working to solve the issue.
We apologize for the inconvenience caused.

OVHcloud Technical team
